p: Edible films and coatings are thin layers of material (their thickness is generally less than 0.3 mm) used for enrobing the food product to replace or fortify the natural layers and can be consumed as a part of the product or with further removal [ 8, 9]. Therefore, the materials used in the formulation should conform to the general food laws and regulations [ 10]. Additionally, the coatings and films should not affect the organoleptic properties of the food product negatively [ 6].
